Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Nosebleed \Nose"bleed`\, n. 1. A bleeding at the nose. [1913 Webster]
2. (Bot.) The yarrow. See {Yarrow}. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Yarrow \Yar"row\, n. [OE. yarowe, yarwe, [yogh]arowe, AS. gearwe; akin to D. gerw, OHG. garwa, garawa, G. garbe, schafgarbe, and perhaps to E. yare.] (Bot.) An American and European composite plant ({Achillea Millefolium}) with very finely dissected leaves and small white corymbed flowers. It has a strong, and somewhat aromatic, odor and taste, and is sometimes used in making beer, or is dried for smoking. Called also {milfoil}, and {nosebleed}. [1913 Webster]
nosebleed n : bleeding from the nose [syn: {epistaxis}]
